Review: This absolutely floored me. This is my first Ali Abbasi film and he took me for a fucking ride, it seems like we have a lot of the same favorite directors in common. I love movies that are character driven not plot driven and this film, even though it had a plot was centered around the serial killer of Saeed. He took elements from Scorsese, Coppola, Bresson, and Schrader to not only show you the killer but deconstruct him, humanize him, and show you him from all angles as a man.

“A wrong note in Beethoven is less offensive than mangling the spirit of it.”Erika is honestly the biggest wierdo ever trying to act normal in society, she hides it with a hard exterior and a talent for being tremendous at playing and teaching piano. She’s a middle aged women who lives with an extremely controlling mother, whom she sleeps in the same bed with. She gets off on voyeurism, even goes to video shops to watch pornos and smell…

American Fiction is a story about the importance of the importance of telling black stories the correct way because it’s often times exploited even if told by the same pov because of selling out. This film has great black satire, and it surprised me by smacking in the face by having a moving plot line surrounded around family. The cast was tremendous lead by their lead in Jeffery Wright, but Sterling K Brown really surprised.

Kevin Costner is the sports movie actor god. I don’t think any actor has as many great sports movies as him, and I had such low expectations for this and it blew it out the park. Being directed by Ivan Reitman there was a great tone of comedy in this flick, but not too extreme where you could enjoy the storyline and characters. I’m always a sucker when they get when they get licensing and work with the real teams,…

“Nobody wants wedding dresses now too many women, not enough men.”I’m so glad i didn’t grow up in a time of a great war, because they affected each and every household directly or indirectly. I knew Rainer had made another masterpiece of a film when destitute Maria bargained her mother two packs of camel cigarettes for her broach. It was interesting seeing a WW2 film from the German perspective, especially a post WW2 film and the impact it had.…

So tender, so human, so broken, Mike Leigh writes his screenplays from a real place he doesn’t bullshit or try to go with the status quo, he always provokes intimate thinking after watching his films. You can never just watch one of his films and turn it off and go somewhere else in your head, they stick with you for a while. That’s the hallmark of a great director.This hooks you right from the beginning because it’s comes at…

I had been looking to watch this movie for years but couldn’t find it anywhere. I gasped out loud when I saw it on Netflix because I’ve tried to download it a thousand times over the years and couldn’t find a version I liked. This was everything I had been waiting for. I’ve been waiting to see my fav director do a deep character study on a woman, and this is right before he made my favorite film in ‘Taxi…

“I don’t wanna be on TV, i wanna be on FOX.”I honestly feel like Jay Roach makes some of his movies for me. Specially his political movies ‘Recount’ and ‘Game Change’ I feel are some of the best political movies of the past 25 years. But when I look at other people’s opinions no one agrees with me. I didn’t watch this movie for the longest because it had horrible reviews then I remembered nobody felt the same way…

Why are reviews and ratings on this movie complete shit like this is unwatchable? This is a pretty decent movie, with a good premise. I have wanted to watch this movie for years but never did because of its poor reviews but I gave it a shot today cause I couldn’t find anything else to watch. This was great and extremely entertaining, with Neill Blomkamp doing what he does best in his niche; and that’s taking us into a dystopia…

One thing about John Boorman films is they are raw, unhinged, and get straight to the point. His films have no fat, and I love them for it even though I’ve only seen this and ‘Deliverance’. Both of which are perfect thrillers in my eyes that push the boundaries, something I always tip my hat off for a director if they are able to achieve it correctly, let alone on multiple occasions. This is my first time seeing Lee Marvin…

I have a buddy of mine whose dad passed right when the pandemic started and he didn’t get to say goodbye to him in the traditional way and it really scarred him, he still wears a mask out till this day. I felt like this film was a perfect representation of what health care workers went thru in the COVID pandemic and how they were drowning at a point.
